page.lettertext:
fol.366r
Belgia 1592 20 Decem
b
To S
r
Thomas Henage
May it please yo
r
H. to be certified, that I
have lately receaved
at l
re
of yo
r
H. wherein
yow signifie unto me, howe gratiously her Ma
tie
accepted of my present. W
ch
hath eased my mind
of a great deale of feare, for
at I doubted my
judgement in
e choise of
e same. And yet I
thought it not unworthy to be seene of her Hig
es
both because it was rare for glasse and enamel,
and because I was assurred, upon
e credit of
e
workman,
at he
had
had
never
before seen
made
e like
made
before,
nor made
e like himself
before,
nor would
not undertake, it was so
tedious
trobles
o
unto him,
to make
e like heereafter. And if I chaunced
to committe any grosse incongruitie in
e beau-
tifieng of it, I would be glad to cast
e fault
upon my living so long in this lumpishe aire
of
Holland
, w
ch
hath made me more then ever
Crassum et Batavum
, and out of tune alto-
gether for daintie conceates. But yet I hope
in some part I may be refined, when her Hig
es
shall be pleased to licence my returne. And
as yo
r
H. in
at behalf hath delivered
e ti-
dinges of her welcome promise, so I humbly
beseche yow, to notifie for me my most duti-
full thankes. I protest unto yo
r
H. in
regard of my desire to satisfie her Ma
tie
it is
nether the time,
at is
weerisome
tedious
unto me, albeit
I have bin heere for fower yeres together, [nor]
fol.366v
yet
e qualitie of my service, having alwaies ha[d]
to deale w
t
a
no
un
pleasing kind of people, but I am
very muche pressed in my privat estate, to solicit
my returne assoone as is possible. And yet it is n[.]
my estate
at is deerer unto me then her Ma
ties
con-
tent: but my care is to provide for
e one and the
other. For w
ch
I hold my self happy,
at this oppor
tunitie is presented unto me, to recommend my
petition to yo
r
Honorable furtherance. I am
very well assured,
at my singular good Lady the
Countesse of Warwicke
, will insist
as she hath be
in her moti
o
gonne,
till my licence
shall
be signed: and if yo
r
H.
in like maner will vouchesafe yo
r
helping hand,
I shall obtene, I doe not doubt, a
very
speedy revo
cation. I can not crave it as a benefit,
t
I
have any way deserved, or as having any meanes to
deserve it in time, but onely up
o
hope
t
a thankfull
acknowledgem
t
, and
e offer of my service in all your
occasions, is as much as you expect
t
I should
fourme:
and so I know I shall be able, and will allwayes
endevour to deserve it of your Honour.
Wherw
t
I take
my humble leave. Fr
o
e Hage. De
c
20 1592.
